pr_title: HIVE-23730: TezCompiler tracking the original TS key columnName

timeline.bodyText: Can you check if this can already be done by any of the utility methods in OperatorUtils? If it is not, can we move it to that class with rest of utility methods in case it is useful in the future?
timeline.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText: Utility method is now moved to operatorUtils
replies.author: pgaref

timeline.bodyText:
You could throw an error only if you are running in test mode:
if (conf.getBoolVar(ConfVars.HIVE_IN_TEST)) {
...

While I am not a huge fan of interleaving a check like this within the production code, it may help you identify any issues, gaps, or regressions in the future.
If you do not want to do that, an alternative is uploading a patch throwing an error instead of printing the warning to get a complete test run, then create follow-up issues if there are any. It will not help you with regressions in the future, but you will be able to identify any existing issue.
timeline.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText:
Hey @jcamachor , thanks for the comments!
The HIVE_IN_TEST trick could work as long we enable probedecode optimisation by default right? (currently if off)
Just enabled the optimisation for this PR (throwing an exception instead of warn) to identify any existing issues.
replies.author: pgaref

replies.bodyText:
Qtest results here:
http://ci.hive.apache.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/hive-precommit/detail/PR-1152/4/tests/
Seems that for for existing MJ ops the probedecode optimisation works fine (properly finds original TS col alias as well). Not sure if we want to enable probe by default however. Thoughts? cc @ashutoshc
replies.author: pgaref

replies.bodyText: Cool! I think we should enable it by default indeed.
replies.author: jcamachor
